title: Virgin Orbit launches Space Force mission
summary: Virgin Orbit successfully placed a set of payloads for the U.S. Space Force into orbit early July 2 in the company’s first nighttime launch.

title: Watch live: NASA moving SLS moon rocket back to hangar this morning
summary: NASA’s powerful new Space Launch System moon rocket is being hauled from its launch pad back to the Vehicle Assembly Building at the Kennedy Space Center Saturday morning for final repairs, testing and closeouts, moving closer to liftoff later this summer after completing a fueling demonstration last month. The rollback is began at 4:12 a.m. EDT (0812 GMT).

title: Watch live: NASA moving SLS moon rocket back to hangar tonight
summary: NASA’s powerful new Space Launch System moon rocket will be hauled from its launch pad back to the Vehicle Assembly Building at the Kennedy Space Center overnight Friday into early Saturday morning for final repairs, testing and closeouts, moving closer to liftoff later this summer after completing a fueling demonstration last month.

title: ULA’s Atlas 5 launches U.S. Space Force experimental missile-warning satellite
summary: A United Launch Alliance Atlas 5 rocket on July 1 launched the USSF-12 mission for the U.S. Space Force. The rocket lifted off at 7:15 p.m. Eastern from Space Launch Complex-41 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station, Florida.

title: Agile to consolidate operations in new Colorado plant
summary: Agile Space Industries is preparing to consolidate propulsion design, manufacturing and production in a new 1,860-square-meter facility in Durango, Colorado.

title: Yes, Boeing’s Starliner spacecraft really could fly astronauts this year
summary: Early data reviews of Starliner's first flight look good.

title: Atlas V launches two experimental military satellites on USSF-12 mission
summary: United Launch Alliance will deploy a pair of Space Force technology demonstration payloads into geostationary orbit Friday evening. The USSF-12 mission lifted off from Cape Canaveral at 7:15 PM EDT (23:15 UTC) on Friday, following a 24 hour delay from Thursday due to weather as well as additional weather delays early in the Friday window.

title: OneWeb to launch second-generation satellites with Relativity Space
summary: OneWeb will launch some of its next-generation satellites on Relativity Space’s next-generation launch vehicle starting as soon as 2025, the companies announced June 30.

title: Rocket Report: ULA starts military lobbying campaign, SLS to launch in 2 months
summary: "I don't think we're stretching ourselves to get there."

title: Venus orbiter, lunar constellation and exoplanets telescopes among candidates as China selects new space science missions
summary: The Chinese Academy Sciences is preparing to select a new batch of space missions from proposals to study Earth, the Sun and solar system, and the deeper universe as part of a "New Horizons Program."
